methods.description: In addition to authenticating this request like other API requests, this request can be made with authentication using "basic auth" to pass the user's normal Pivotal Tracker login credentials (their email address or user name plus their password). In this way, client software can use the user's name and password to obtain their API Token, and then use that token to authenticate future API requests made on behalf of that user. Obviously, the user's password should not be stored or otherwise retained.

created_after.name: created_after
created_after.description: Show notifications created after this date/time. If this parameter is not provided, the default is 10 days prior to the request time.

envelope.name: envelope
envelope.description: The standard formatting parameters cannot be included in requests for this operation. In particular, envelope= is prohibited and Tracker behaves as if envelope=true had been provided.

before.name: before
before.description: Mark all notifications before this id as read

methods.description: Marks the person's notifications as read up to the given notification id.
Return list of the selected activity for the authenticated person.
Return list of workspaces for the authenticated person.
Create a new workspace for the authenticated person.
Return a workspace for the authenticated person.
Returns list of notifications for the specified person whose updated_at values are less than the timestamp.

account_ids.name: account_ids
account_ids.description: A comma separated list of account ids whose projects should be returned

methods.description: Get all of a user's active projects.
Fetch the content of the specified project.

scope.name: scope
scope.description: Restricts the state of iterations to return. If not specified, it defaults to all iterations including done.

methods.description: Return a set of iterations from the project.
Create a new integration for a project.

exclude_linked.name: exclude_linked
exclude_linked.description: When this parameter is present and true, response will not include external stories which already have matching Pivotal Tracker stories.

methods.description: Provides external_story records for all of the potential stories available through the selected integration (already configured on the selected project). The content of the objects returned is suitable for use as parameters to create stories 'imported from' the selected integration.
List all of the memberships in a project.
Add a user to the project
Provides all of the project's labels.
Creates a label on the project.

filter.name: filter
filter.description: This parameter supplies a search string; only stories that match the search criteria are returned.

with_label.name: with_label
with_label.description: A story's current_state which all returned stories must match.

accepted_before.name: accepted_before
accepted_before.description: A date and time (ISO 8601 format or milliseconds) which all returned stories are accepted before.

accepted_after.name: accepted_after
accepted_after.description: A date and time (ISO 8601 format or milliseconds) which all returned stories are accepted after.

created_before.name: created_before
created_before.description: A date and time (ISO 8601 format or milliseconds) which all returned stories are created before.

created_after.name: created_after
created_after.description: A date and time (ISO 8601 format or milliseconds) which all returned stories are created after.

updated_before.name: updated_before
updated_before.description: A date and time (ISO 8601 format or milliseconds) which all returned stories are updated before.

updated_after.name: updated_after
updated_after.description: A date and time (ISO 8601 format or milliseconds) which all returned stories are updated after.

deadline_before.name: deadline_before
deadline_before.description: A date and time (ISO 8601 format or milliseconds) that release dates fall before.

deadline_after.name: deadline_after
deadline_after.description: A date and time (ISO 8601 format or milliseconds) that release dates fall after.

methods.description: Returns the tasks on a specified story.
Returns the task that was created.
Returns the specified task on a specified story.
Returns the label that was created.
Returns the labels on a specified story.
Removes the label from the story.
Returns the owners of a specified story.
Add a user as an owner of the story.
Removes ownership of a story from a person.

since_version.name: since_version
since_version.description: Activity will be returned only for operations that occurred after the specified version.

comment.name: comment
comment.description: The comment with which the file attachment will be associated.

file.name: file
file.description:
The content of the file being uploaded. It is expected to be incorporated in the multipart data with a 'Content-Disposition' of 'form-data; name="file"; filename="imperial_banner.png"'. 
A Content-Type that describes the file being uploaded should be supplied if possible.

methods.description: Upload a file to the Tracker server. Tracker will create a matching file_attachment object which can be attached to a future comment on a story.

query.name: query
query.description: String containing the search terms and options.

methods.description: Provides a list of the searches which have been saved by the current person.

since_version.name: since_version
since_version.description: Activity will be returned only for operations that occurred after the specified version.

methods.description: Return list of the selected project activity.

POSTing is used to send story-selection parameters. The server responds with a CSV export file containing data from the selected stories.

inline.name: inline
inline.description: Determines if server should include response headers that would cause a browser to show the attachment in a new tab or window (inline=true) or show a Save dialog box (inline=false). Default is false.

methods.description: Fetch items describing the user's available Google resources.

The aggregator allows the client to make a single request that returns the same information as several separate GETs to other endpoints.
